WorkItem.Description:
Hi, 

I have a tree-view with a lot of data and branches and I want to restrict the selection of nodes to certain level lets say level 3 and when user select multiple nodes or one, user will drag the nodes and drop it on the text-box and full path of the nodes will appear in the text-box or list-box. 

Let me know can I achieve this with this Tree-view. 

Thanks, 
Attiqe
WorkItem.Summary: Drag from Tree view & Drop on other WPF controls

Comments.Message:
In order to prevent selection you can register to the Event OnSelecting of TreeViewEx. It has a CancelEventArg.

Getting the path is nothing the TreeViewEx can be responsible for. But I think the logic can easyly implemented by yourself.

This path you can return by the overridable drag method of your NodeViewModel. Take a look at the DragNDrop sample for more details. This data is given to the WPF DragNDropSystem (wrapped in a DataObject).

Hope this helps.
